Text: Due to Russia’s military activity on the Ukrainian border, the U.S. State Dept is strongly urging U.S. citizens not to travel to Ukraine. The State Dept is also strongly advising Americans now in Ukraine to depart the country. Read the entire advisory:  https://t.co/KEOFDvaGIz
We must stand together to condemn Vladimir Putin’s threatening stance towards Ukraine. The United States and our allies must stand together to prevent bloodshed and to demand accountability.

On President’s Day, we reflect on the great leaders who have helped forge our nation. Let’s take this time to reflect on their leadership which has steadied our nation through both prosperity and adversity and kept us unified as a nation.
With mask mandates being lifted across the nation, we must remember to still protect our communities. Mask-up, get vaccinated & boosted.

The bipartisan infrastructure law invests $7.5B in new spending for #ElectrifyingAmerica. Now, electric vehicles will be a practical option for more Americans with more convenient, reliable, affordable, and equitable charging – all while creating good-paying union jobs.
Thanks to House Democrats and @POTUS: GDP grew last year to 5.7%, 6.6 million new jobs were created, and the unemployment rate dropped from 6.4% when Democrats took office to around 4%.
On Friday, we celebrated California Ports Day—a day to highlight the men and women who have worked so hard throughout the pandemic to keep America’s shelves stocked. Thank you #HeroesAtOurPorts

The Biden Admin announced new actions to support American leadership on clean manufacturing – low-carbon production of the steel & aluminum for electric vehicles, wind turbines, & solar panels to upgrade our transportation infrastructure.
Please remember our best defense against COVID-19 is testing regularly, masking-up, and making sure you get vaccinated and boosted. Simple steps can make a big impact.

Compared to this time last year, sales at grocery stores, restaurants, and clothing stores, among others, increased, underscoring the strength of the American economy as we recovered from the pandemic.

High-speed internet is a necessity. Now households are eligible to receive a discount on their monthly internet bill thanks to the Affordable Connectivity Program – visit https://t.co/sAS8mHiKZk to see if your home qualifies.

I urgently hope that we can reduce tension in Ukraine and avoid the loss of innocent life. The United States and our allies must be a clear and united voice for peace, and we cannot accept or allow unjustified aggression to rob Ukraine of its right to self-determination.
Seniors are hurting and need help now. Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust will boost benefits across the board, helps confront rising costs of living and ensures dignity for millions of Americans.
The president’s #BuildBackBetter agenda includes the largest historic investment to combat climate change. We must #ActOnClimate to create good-paying jobs, and lower energy costs for Americans.

Working parents who simply want to go to work and support their families shouldn’t be held back by the high cost and limited supply of #childcare. Under #BuildBackBetter, no parent will go broke just to afford childcare.

Thanks to funding I supported in the bipartisan infrastructure law, over 10 million households are now enrolled in the Affordable Connectivity Program, the nation’s largest ever program to help families afford high-speed internet.

California has been a national leader with tough vehicle emissions standards. Our ability to regulate emissions from our highways and around the port is critical for the climate and for the health of our community. I applaud this overdue announcement. https://t.co/v7lcvlnXHE

We must make investments that ensure families can navigate work and care responsibilities, and accelerate the transition to clean energy, while lowering out of pocket costs on big-ticket items like childcare and healthcare. 2/2

Even with supply chain issues & the Omicron variant, the U.S. continues to experience a broad-based recovery that has remained resilient. To bolster this economic progress, increase household savings & reduce inflationary pressure long term, Congress must move forward. 1/2

Together, we are #ElectrifyingAmerica to reduce harmful emissions and protect the health of our families and communities, especially those that have historically & unjustly faced the greatest burdens of pollution.

Due to the rising cost of internet service, too many families are unable to get online. Thanks to the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, over 10M families are now enrolled in the Affordable Connectivity Program. See if you’re eligible here: https://t.co/m289jpvb8i

Today, NOAA released their Sea Level Rise Technical Report, providing up-to-date sea level rise projections for the U.S. & our territories. This data will help communities adapt to sea level rise by assessing potential changes in average tide heights: https://t.co/QvvDYPRlb3

These frontline communities aren’t consulted on policies that threaten clean air & water. They pay the price with their health & their lives. The #EJforAll bill we discussed today will give these communities the power to fight back against polluters. 3/3

We heard from East Yard Communities For Justice (EYCFJ) at the hearing. EYCFJ has worked for years with communities from the Eastside of Los Angeles to Long Beach that are overburdened with direct & indirect sources of pollution. 2/3

I joined a Natural Resources hearing today on the Environmental Justice For All Act, a bill to address environmental injustices & ensure we give impacted communities the power to fight back & end this injustice. We cannot #ActOnClimate w/o addressing environmental racism. 1/3

I want to congratulate @BillieJeanKing on her coin toss at the Super Bowl LVI. Yesterday was the 50th anniversary of Title IX, this was truly incredible to see a conversation of equitable opportunities and inclusion across sports and the impact this has made on society.

The MBTA has led to the development of practices, technologies & guidelines that have saved millions of birds from further devastation. The MBTA is also critical to ensuring accountability from those causing negative impacts to our bird populations. 2/2  https://t.co/bV0zO19BID

Joined @RepBrianFitz, @RepCarbajal & House colleagues calling on @SecHaaland to take further action to help migratory bird populations by upholding & improving existing legislative tools to protect birds and their habitats, such as the Migratory Bird Treaty Act (MBTA). 1/2

Today, we remember the 17 lives lost on February 14, 2018 at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida. We stand with the victims’ families and survivors and are committed to making our schools and communities safer from gun violence. #NeverAgain.
Today is a great day to get vaccinated or boosted against COVID-19. Let’s continue to do our part and remember to mask-up—for yourself, for your loved ones and for your community.
GREAT NEWS: Thanks to @HouseDemocrats and @POTUS, our Democratic majorities in Congress have led our nation to the greatest year of job creation in American history!

The importance of our national efforts to #ElectrifyingAmerica is to reduce harmful emissions and protect the health of our families and communities, especially those that have historically faced the greatest burdens of pollution.

This week, I joined colleagues from the CA congressional delegation to urge the Biden administration to focus electric vehicle infrastructure investments on critical freight shipping routes, like those at our ports. We can improve our health, air quality, & fight climate change.

We are #ElectrifyingAmerica to #ActOnClimate. $5B in new spending from the bipartisan infrastructure act will create a national network of 500K electric vehicles chargers’ w/CA alone receiving $56M. This will reduce pollution AND meet the mobility needs of American families.

We must protect our LGBTQ+ community abroad from persecution. H.R. 3485, the #GlobalRespectAct does just that by sanctioning individuals and nations who commit these abuses. I was proud to vote to pass this critical bill.
The pandemic has caused disruptions and raised prices, but we are going to continue to use every tool we have to bring them down as part of his comprehensive approach to fighting inflation. 2/2

High prices are impacting all of our household budgets. We can take action to help, by lowering prescription drug costs, strengthening our infrastructure and bringing down the cost of energy for consumers. 1/2
Thanks to @HouseDemocrats and @POTUS: GDP grew last year at 5.7%, we created 6.6 million jobs and the unemployment rate dropped from 6.4% from when Democrats took the majority to around 4%.

The @USPS delivers life-saving medications, urgent packages, and much more to Americans across the country. The #PostalServiceReformAct is vital to ensuring the Postal Service can continue its work for years to come.

My friend & colleague @RepCicilline led the House to ensure that the fight for global LGBTQI+ equality can be enshrined in US law.  Across the world, people are attacked for who they are, or who they love. Enough. We can be a beacon for freedom & equality again. #GlobalRespectAct

I’m proud to support H.R. 3485, the #GlobalRespectAct. By passing this bill, Congress is sending a clear message to the LGBTQI+ community at home and abroad: atrocious acts of violence against you will not be tolerated – we stand with you.

Proud to be an original co-sponsor of this critical legislation to give Congressional workers the right to unionize. Every worker deserves the right to organize--let’s make this happen. https://t.co/6oCFzqgPsQ

Proud to help lead this effort, we must #ActOnClimate to protect future generations.  The USPS fleet is a critical tool, and Postmaster DeJoy must not obstruct the drive toward zero- emission tech. https://t.co/QmQHuAniU5

Joined a @NRDems hearing today about the environmental movement’s diversity problem & its impacts on federal enviro policy. Finding an equitable path through the #ClimateCrisis & building an inclusive future requires the environmental movement open up to more diverse voices.

Yesterday, I joined my @TransportDems in a hearing today on how the Water Resources Development Act of 2022 can secure critical resources for the Port of Long Beach. We can strengthen supply chains for the entire nation, and reduce pollution.

California’s statewide indoor mask requirement will expire on 2/15. However, unvaccinated people will still need to wear masks indoors. Please remember our best defense against COVID-19 is getting tested, vaccinated, and boosted.

Yesterday, I voted to pass the Postal Service Reform Act – historic legislation to codify 6-day mail delivery & repeal the onerous pre-funding mandate for USPS retiree health benefits—critical steps to ensure efficient mail delivery & restore USPS financial solvency.
We have to keep working to keep wages up and prices down. That’s why I am working hard with my House colleagues to fix supply chains and #BuildBackBetter.
Remember: You can get FREE at home COVID test kits. These kits can help to protect yourself, community and loved ones from COVID-19. https://t.co/pjQ9wKzDNj

Forced arbitration clauses are the still-silenced part of the Me Too movement, denying survivors their day in court and shielding abusers in the shadows. That’s why I proudly voted for the #EndForecedArbitration Act – to make sure survivors’ voices are heard.

The House-passed #AmericaCOMPETES Act will elevate American leadership in the global arena – putting diplomacy first, strengthening our alliances, combatting unfair trade practices and standing up for our national values.

In January, our economy created 467,000 jobs. Thanks to the American Rescue Plan passed by @HouseDemocrats, and our successful vaccination program, Americans are back at work at a record-setting pace with 6.6 million jobs created in @POTUS’ first year in office.

The #CleanWaterAct turns 50 this year. It’s more vital than ever to strengthen our nation’s commitment to clean water. Today, I joined 120 @HouseDemocrats calling on the EPA & Army Corp to remove the Trump #DirtyWaterRule once and for all.
82 years later, Social Security remains the single most reliable program for middle class Americans. It’s time we expand to ensure that all Americans get a fair shot. #Secure2100
Today is a great day to remember to mask-up, test regularly, get vaccinated and boosted. These simple steps can help protect us against COVID-19.
With nearly half a million new jobs created in the last month, powered by @POTUS ‘leadership and Democrats’ effective economic plan, we are putting America back to work.

Since @POTUS issued his executive order addressing climate change, we have taken important steps to restore contaminated sites, improve air quality near ports and highways, and ensure that our drinking water is free of lead and other toxins. #ActOnClimate
On this #WorldCancerDay, it is essential to show how important it is that every single American has access to quality health care. #MedicareForAll will do just that and save millions of lives.
I support the right for workers to organize. Making sure workers have that option is important. Every worker deserves a union. https://t.co/BqNsFDIBzb

Car prices have been sky-high, and US autoworkers have faced job losses because of shortages of computer chips which are vital for modern cars. It’s time to make those chips here in America. Costs will come down. #AmericaCOMPETES (8/8)
Californians rely on healthy oceans. The America COMPETES act invests in protecting and restoring critical ocean ecosystems and combating illegal fishing. (7/8)

When we invest in clean tech, we become a global leader on climate change, & the whole world benefits. The America COMPETES Act makes historic investments to promote clean power & climate change mitigation abroad, advancing our influence & slashing global carbon emissions. (6/8)

The US must become a clean technology champion. The America COMPETES act provides historic investments in the National Science Foundation to mitigate the risks of climate change, and to invest in the critical minerals technologies we need for a new generation of batteries. (5/8)

#AmericaCOMPETES builds clean energy supply chains by investing in American-made solar technology and strengthens our electrical grid to prepare for more zero-emission technology. This means ultimately cheaper energy, more US jobs, and a cleaner environment. (4/8)
The #AmericaCOMPETES Act includes critical measures to make sure our trade partners uphold human rights and environmental protections. Our values can be a source of strength. (3/8)

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act: Reauthorizes & modernizes the Trade Adjustment Assistance programs to provide overdue resources to American workers impacted by globalization. It’s time to take bold action to better support American workers! (2/8)

The U.S. has the potential to compete globally in innovation & technology. The #AmericaCOMPETES Act provides the critical resources and tools we need to achieve that. I’m proud & look forward to working with my colleges on this transformative legislation (1/9)

House Democrats are continuing to fight #ForThePeople. With the administration, we have enacted the American Rescue Plan and the bipartisan infrastructure act. As a result, Americans are seeing economic growth is up, wages are rising, & unemployment has dropped.

Cancer is the leading cause of death in the U.S. & takes countless lives each year. To fight this disease, we must take bold decisive action to make strong improvements & investments in our research & prevention. I applaud @POTUS on his relaunch of the cancer moonshot initiative.

The 2022 tax season began last Monday. If you received #ChildTaxCredit payments or stimulus checks in 2021, please see the important information at the link below on how to file. https://t.co/Fv8wgHAKZK

Democrats have visited OVER 1000 infrastructure projects in our communities. I was proud to help deliver the bipartisan infrastructure act to fund these projects at @portoflongbeach and elsewhere to bring our infrastructure into the 21st century. #DemocratsDelieverInfrastructure.
To my dear friend @SenatorLujan, I want to wish you a healthy and speedy recovery, my thoughts are with you and your family during this time.

The recent oil spill off the coast of Orange County, CA led to major environmental damage & the death of wildlife, including many birds. We must continue to have tools like the Migratory Bird Treaty Act (MBTA) in place to assist with accountability & recovery.

The U.S. has endless potential to compete globally in innovation & technology- the #AmericaCOMPETES Act provides the critical resources and tools we need to achieve that. I look forward to working with my colleagues on this transformative legislation.

Today, I joined my @TransportDem colleagues for a hearing on the future of autonomous vehicle technologies. It is critical that we ensure the safe deployment of new technologies while safeguarding the interests of American workers.

John spent his life fighting to ensure that every American has access to the ballot box and is not denied the right to vote. His legacy, from the Pettus Bridge to the halls of Congress, is one we must work every day to honor and to fulfill. 2/2

On the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth, I voted to pass #HR5577, legislation to honor the legacy of my dear friend, Congressman John Lewis by renaming the Atlanta main post office as the John R. Lewis Post Office. 1/2

Today, we honor the 900,000 lives lost due to the COVID-19 pandemic. We must continue to mask-up, get vaccinated and if eligible receive your booster shot. Let us do this for ourselves, community members & loved ones.

This #BlackHistoryMonth, we honor the history and achievements of Black Americans and celebrate their contributions. We must remain committed to fulfilling the promise of a nation where all are treated equally.

Gun violence leaves a mark on each individual and community it impacts. We must support survivors and work to end gun violence so no one else has to endure what they went through. This Gun Violence Survivors Week let’s recommit to that goal. #GVSurvivorsWeek.
Welcome to the Year of the Tiger. The tiger symbolizes a competitive nature, courage, and ambition. I want to wish all those celebrating #LunarNewYear a joyous, healthy, and prosperous new year.

With funding from the American Rescue Plan, the U.S. Dept of Labor has announced up to $15M in grants to states & territories to help address those disparities & begin to help workers understand the application process for claiming & receiving benefits & related services. 2/2

The COVID-19 pandemic exposed disparities in access to benefits affecting women, communities of color and other marginalized workers, and often delayed delivery of much needed financial support and services. 1/2

@HouseDemocrats and @POTUS have delivered. The bipartisan infrastructure act provides $17 billion for hundreds of projects building back better ports, harbors, and waterways, while creating jobs, economic opportunity, and strengthening our water infrastructure.

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will strengthen our economy and national security by providing $45 billion in funding to support #supplychain resilience and manufacturing of critical goods, industrial equipment and manufacturing technology for goods made right here in the United States.

Too many families are unable to access online learning & telehealth visits due to the rising cost of internet service. I voted for the bipartisan infrastructure act that provides up to $30 off a family’s monthly internet bill. Visit https://t.co/m289jpvb8i to see if you qualify.

Voting rights, public health mandates, the environment, and many other issues are facing a Court that is seriously out of balance. We need to ensure Justice Breyer’s replacement brings that balance. 2/2

The news of Supreme Court Justice Breyer’s retirement comes at a critical moment in the fight for our fundamental constitutional rights and freedoms, with threats to reproductive freedoms at the very forefront. 1/2

As the temperature drops, struggling families should not have to worry about how they will keep warm. @HHSGov’s Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program, also known as LIHEAP, is here to help. https://t.co/Jq5W2Ny0sa

Great news for our ports, harbors, and waterways: the bipartisan infrastructure act will provide $17 billion to carry out 500 projects across the nation. These will strengthen critical supply chains, build climate resiliency, and protect our environment.
One year ago today, the Biden Administration took the first step of recommitting the U.S. to global reproductive health and rights by rescinding the overreaching and dangerous #GlobalGagRule.

Thank you @SecretaryPete for joining my SoCal colleagues and I to discuss the impacts of ports & goods movement in our communities. The bipartisan infrastructure act invests in our communities and will provide good-paying union jobs. https://t.co/uPeFMiT5Ou
I applaud this decision and was happy to see the amicus brief I submitted with @RepRaulGrijalva and @RepHuffman quoted in the Court’s decision. https://t.co/h5F9rGyoSk

Too many families are unable to access online learning & telehealth visits due to the rising cost of internet service. I voted for the bipartisan infrastructure law, which provides up to $30 off a family’s monthly internet bill-visit https://t.co/m289jpvb8i to see if you qualify.

NASA announced today that they have selected 3 Long Beach firms to support the agency’s $300M Venture-Class Acquisition of Dedicated and Rideshare (VADR) missions: Relativity Space, Rocket Lab and Virgin Orbit Congrats. I’m a proud supporter of our thriving aerospace sector.

America is on the move. We have had the fastest economic growth since 1984, a record number of jobs created, and a record drop in our unemployment rate. Our work is not over. We must continue to Build Back Better.  https://t.co/1XffewMm3G

Today, I am pleased to announce a record 14.5 million Americans signed up for health insurance under ACA in the past year, including 1.8M Californians. Until Jan 31, Californians can still sign up for coverage through Covered California at https://t.co/7cR5vzsgSp

On this #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we must remember the more than 6 million lives lost & recommit ourselves to fighting bigotry, racism, antisemitism and hatred of all kinds. History can only repeat if we forget the past. Never forget.

I thank SCOTUS Justice Breyer for his service to our country.  President Biden should move quickly to appoint a qualified, progressive voice to ensure that the Supreme Court truly represents our country and can defend our constitutional values.

@NASAWebb space telescope is in orbit & one step closer to unlocking more secrets of the universe. Congrats to @NASA, @ESA, @CSA_ASC, & the 1.2k+ scientists, engineers, & technicians behind this remarkable telescope. #UnfoldTheUniverse.

Victims of long COVID have been overlooked for too long. Collecting robust data will help us to understand this illness & target resources to the most impacted.  I support @RepDonBeyer & @RepPressley calling on @CDCgov to publicly report this data.  https://t.co/1hsV7u1iLZ

What @POTUS said when he signed Executive Order 14004 one year ago is still true today: “All Americans qualified to serve in the Armed Forces of the United States should be able to serve.” Transgender Americans in uniform make our country stronger. #TransRightsAreHumanRights.

Climate provisions in the Build Back Better Act can create good-paying union jobs, advance justice, and put us on the path to cut climate pollution in half by 2030. #ClimateAction cannot wait. We must get this done. #PassTheClimateBill.

She will make the decision on instituting a 20-year mining ban. Today's news is a critical next step in protecting our most visited wilderness area, but there's still more to be done to protect the Boundary Waters area for all future generations to come. 3/3

Next up, the US Forest Service & the Bureau of Land Management will be finishing the environmental study that was triggered by the application for a 20-year mining ban in the watershed of the Boundary Waters. That study will be delivered to Sec. Haaland. 2/3

I applaud the Biden admin for their action today canceling the unlawfully renewed Twin Metals sulfide-ore copper mining leases next to the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness. This action restores the legal interpretation of 5 previous presidential admins. 1/3

@NASAWebb space telescope is in orbit & one step closer to unlocking secrets of the universe. Congrats to @NASA, @ESA, @CSA_ASC, & the 1.2k+ scientists, engineers, & technicians behind this remarkable telescope. #UnfoldTheUniverse.

Tongass National Forest old growth must be part of our climate strategy. @SecVilsack & the @ForestService must restore roadless protections on the Tongass, and I urge them to work closely with indigenous & local communities in doing so. #ProtectTheTongass. https://t.co/wkVExJQ0Ke

Reducing greenhouse gas emissions is our best chance to leave future generations a livable planet. Today, I joined w/190+ of my Democratic colleagues in filing an amicus brief w/SCOTUS supporting the EPA’s ability to regulate CO2 emissions.
I scored 100% on @NETWORKLobby’s 2021 Voting Record! I'm proud of my votes to protect our democracy in a challenging year. See how other Members of Congress scored here: https://t.co/X92qkiHG7r

The new bipartisan infrastructure law will boost U.S. electric vehicle markets & combat climate change by: Investing $7.5 billion in a national EV charging network, deploying chargers for long & short distance travel, and create new, good paying jobs across our country.
Is it time for your COVID booster? If so, get boosted! For more information, check here: https://t.co/6ekRS4dXvq

Tax season is starting. When completing your return make sure stimulus payments & advance #ChildTaXCredit information is accurate, use e-file deposit to avoid delays, & remember free resources are available:  https://t.co/K9IlFg1KOZ

The U.S. Supreme Court will hear a case that may determine whether affirmative action in university admissions violate civil rights laws. I support affirmative action, and a ruling against it could have far-reaching implications for colleges & students across the country.

I support the #FightForVotingRights. The GOP has repeatedly blocked legislation that would protect voting rights & strengthen democracy. Sadly, 2 Dem Senators also refused to change Senate filibuster rules to allow the vote. We must defend the right to vote for all Americans.

Congress must act to codify the right to abortion care. And we must all redouble our efforts to ensure that people have the ability to create the futures they want, including making decisions about if, when, and how to build their families. 3/3

In addition to Texas, elected officials in dozens of states over the past several years have passed hundreds of legislative restrictions on abortion, threatening to eviscerate the protections of Roe v. Wade. 2/3

This weekend marks the 49th anniversary of the Roe v. Wade ruling, which legalized abortion in the U.S. As we have seen w/the recent Supreme Court rulings refusing to block a TX law which restricts abortion access, it’s clear SCOTUS has eroded a women’s right to choose. 1/3

Regardless of zip code, EVERY community deserves access to reliable, affordable high-speed internet. The new bipartisan infrastructure law provides $65 billion to help close the digital divide and get more Americans connected.

By automatically enrolling veterans in VA healthcare services, @RepMarkTakano’s EVEST Act will help meet veterans’ mental health needs, increase veterans’ access to healthcare, and make sure no servicemember is left behind. I’m proud to support it and glad it passed this week.
…and to let him know that I look forward to working with him on many important issues relating to US-Vietnam relations. 3/3

…I have been fortunate to work closely with several Ambassadors to Vietnam. I look forward to doing the same with Ambassador Knapper. I shared with Ambassador Knapper the concerns of my constituents regarding the human rights record of the Vietnamese government,… 2/3

Today I met with the newly confirmed U.S. Ambassador to Vietnam Marc Knapper on his confirmation and swearing-in as the new U.S. Ambassador to Vietnam. During my tenure in Congress, representing one of the largest Vietnamese American communities outside Vietnam,… 1/3

Thanks to the President’s infrastucture bill, 500 new projects worth $14 Billion are in the infrastructure pipeline nationwide, with a focus on easing supply chain problems and addressing climate change.  https://t.co/a0stllJpMV

I voted for the John R. Lewis voting rights bill because it is the only way to protect the fundamental right to vote. We must continue to #FightForVotingRights and safeguard our democracy – there is too much at stake.

By automatically enrolling veterans in VA healthcare services, @RepMarkTakano’s EVEST Act will help meet veterans’ mental health needs, increase veterans’ access to healthcare, and make sure no servicemember is left behind. I’m proud to support it and glad it passed today.

Not only will this bill protect albatrosses and petrels but will create equity for our fisheries. This legislation will also allow the US to promote more stringent international regulations to level the playing field between domestic and international fisheries. 2/2

I am proud to co-lead the bipartisan Albatross and Petrel Conservation Act legislation with my friend and colleague @RepBrianFitz. Today, I presented the bill at a Natural Resources subcommittee on Water, Oceans, and Wildlife hearing. 
1/2

Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law, California will receive $4.25 billion over the next five years to upgrade bridges, which will: create jobs, connect communities, increase global competitiveness, & bring California into the 21st century.

The Senate GOP have repeatedly used the filibuster to block crucial legislation to safeguard voting rights. Minority rule is not democratic. We must ensure the Senate can function on behalf of the people. The Senate must pass the Freedom To Vote Act! #FightForVotingRights
Americans can now sign up to receive FREE COVID-19 at-home test kits through @USPS. Testing, masking-up, and getting vaccinated is our path to combating this pandemic. https://t.co/jfyaNAassw

The Red Cloud Wind Project began commercial operations last month, moving the LA Department of Water & Power (LADWP) closer to becoming 100% carbon free by 2035. This is the largest, most efficient, and lowest cost wind farm in LADWP’s renewable energy portfolio to date.
The Omicron surge is driving COVID-19 infections to historic new highs. Our best defense to fight the spread and other variants is to wear a mask, keep our distance, get vaccinated and boosted.

Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure legislation, @POLB will receive $8 million to support the latest phase of a dredging project that will allow larger cargo vessels to safely call at the port. We will continue to fight for more resources for stronger, greener supply chains.
I applaud the $28 million investment from the infrastructure act announced today that will bring to fruition a restored Los Angeles River that will be a natural treasure for the region. 2/2

Over the past two decades the relationship between the residents of SoCal & the LA River has dramatically changed. Thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure act, we can transform a mere flood control channel into a healthy and thriving ecosystem, & new habitat. 1/2
The surge of COVID-19 cases in the U.S. highlights the importance of getting vaccinated and if eligible receiving your booster shot – Protect yourself, your loved ones, and your community.

Yesterday, I voted to pass the Supplemental Impact Aid Flexibility Act. This will allow our school districts to use 2021 student & fiscal data to obtain FY23 federal Impact Aid funding, thus preventing reductions in aid funding because of COVID-19.

If you received the #ChildTaxCredit advance payments or stimulus payments in 2021, be on the lookout for filing info letters from the IRS. You will need them for filing. Reminder: 2022 tax season starts January 24 and ends April 18. https://t.co/Fv8wgHAKZK

Starting today, at home rapid COVID tests will be available to order through https://t.co/94zbcGHndH. They’re 100% free & USPS will shop them to your home at no cost.  The site also has info on how to obtain free over-the-counter tests & where you can get in person tests.
A vote for the #FreedomToVoteAct and #JohnLewisVotingRightsAct will defend both the right to vote and our democracy. The Senate must act. #FightForVotingRIghts.

The MLK holiday has special meaning this year. Dr. King fought endlessly for voting rights. He faced down the treat of violence over and over. We will never be intimidated in the face of violence and terror. We must continue to fight for justice & to build a fairer society.

January is National #MentoringMonth. Reflect on how you can help support the next generation of leaders and change-makers. By connecting young people with caring adults, #MentoringAmplifies positive youth development – consider becoming a mentor today! https://t.co/CTwQwqLyJl
Our best defense against COVID-19 is getting vaccinated and boosted – Protect yourself, your loved ones, and your community.

An overwhelming majority of Americans across the country support the reforms in the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act. It is time for the Senate to reflect the will of the people and #FightForVotingRights!  https://t.co/lmYjBKqZbn

Thanks to funding I supported in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, discounts on your monthly internet bill from the Emergency Broadband Benefit will continue with new Affordable Connectivity Program. See if you’re eligible here: https://t.co/m289jpMMwS

Last year, National Guard units from across the nation were in D.C. to protect the Capitol. I voted for the Guard and Reserve GI Bill Parity Act because it would ensure that those who were here have the same access to their GI Bill benefits as their active-duty counterparts.

The U.S. DOT and the Federal Highway Administration announced today the largest formula program investment in American bridges since the creation of the interstate highway system. Our bridges across the state need repair, rehabilitation, and reconstruction #BuildBackBridges.
We need the Build Back Better Act to keep these checks providing families with the funds they need. The Senate needs to pass Build Back Better now. 2/2

The #ChildTaxCredit has helped more than 36 million families afford groceries, pay their bills, and make ends meet. Household bills continue and so should the checks. Monthly Child Tax Credit payments are essential to our recovery. 1/2

The Biden administration has made offshore wind development a major part of its climate agenda. I applaud @SecDebHaaland’s decision to open leasing on 500k acres off the coast of NJ/NY for wind power farms--to fight climate change & create good-paying union jobs.

Thanks to the American Rescue Plan, our economy is bouncing back years faster than experts predicted: Unemployment saw the largest calendar year decrease in history, an historic 6.4 million jobs have been created & new small business applications are rising.

At this critical moment in our democracy, a failure to protect voting rights is not an option. We can’t aid and abet obstructionism. We must do whatever it takes to get this bill across the finish line. For more about the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act, see here. 2/2

Today, I voted to pass the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act--historic legislation which protects the right of every American to vote, ends the dominance of big money in our politics, & further preventing partisan gerrymandering. The Senate must take up this legislation. 1/2
